page.title: 12Farming cont.
page.content: There would be about 80-100 cattle in an average herd which would include cows, bullocks and heifers plus bull. During the winter they are fed on hay, cattle cake, flaked maize, and sometimes turnips. During their second year, the bullocks that are to be sold are fattened on the rape which the farmer grows. The rape is not harvested however. The farmer sections off an area that has grown during the summer with an electric fence and allows the cattle to graze one section at a time. They are ready to be sold at auction during the autumn. An average flock of sheep would be between 150 and 200 including lambs. Because of the severe winter weather which can be experienced due to the northerly latitude of the area studied, hardy breeds such as Scottish Blackface and Bluefaced Leicesters are
